text: Just clarifying, were you able to find your answer <@U01F8TH2952>

Hey devs!

We have a brand new module field in beta, that directly connects the CRM with the CMS, allowing marketers to easily render CRM data on websites (standard and custom objects). The CRM Object selector module field allows a developer to create a module for a particular CRM object type, and the marketer is dynamically presented with a dropdown of instances (records) of that object type.

For example, a developer could create a "Featured Products" module that allowed a marketer to select products from their CRM product library for display on their website. Or, if a customer had a Real Estate custom object, a "Featured Property Listings" module would allow a marketer to select their real estate properties for display.

Interested in giving it a try? DM me!

Additionally, I wanted to make sure everyone was aware the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/custom-objects#display-objects-associated-with-your-custom-objects|crm_associations>, <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/custom-objects#displaying-a-single-crm-object-s-properties-using-the-crm-object-function|crm_object> and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/custom-objects#displaying-the-properties-for-multiple-crm-objects-using-the-crm-objects-function|crm_objects> HubL functions have been updated to support rendering custom object data. These functions can be used to render any of the data housed in your CRM on CMS pages.
I saw this today. very nice
